comments.raw_text: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.4) Gecko/20070515 Firefox/2.0.0.4 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.4) Gecko/20070515 Firefox/2.0.0.4 When page has more than 40 images, Firefox (Mac and PC) tends to insert weird characters such as the question mark below on the img src attributes. Sometimes, the weird characters also appear on the img src itself. Have checked the code in different browsers (ie5.5, ie6, ie7,and safari). All these browsers render the code correctly and do not have any display issues. Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.

as far as i see, this (tested with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a6pre) Gecko/20070626 ID:2007062604) only affects viewing the source, not the rendering of the site itself.
you agree on this ?

comments.raw_text: Unfortunately, the link I gave you before to show the issue somehow now is not showing any problems. As far as I can tell you, when the ? is added on , it usually breaks the layout since there it ceases to be a valid html tag/attribute. I have another sample, but unfortunately it's an internal site to my company (an intranet). I have uploaded the picture to show how the layout breaks because firefox inserts a "?" in the td. This table is also generated dynamically and it renders fine in all IE browsers, plus in Safari (Mac). Additionally, this problem does not happen all the time. It happens randomly and I have already tried removing all JS to check if that's causing the issue. Check the code below to see the ? where the file size is displayed. Clarification - Client Edit 31.00 KB 5/8/2007 Michael Agellon Delete This is the response header for that page Date: Wed, 27 Jun 2007 01:45:48 GMT Server: Microsoft-IIS/6.0 X-Powered-By: ASP.NET 2.0, ASP.NET X-AspNet-Version: 1.1.4322 Cache-Control: private Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Content-Length: 95841

comments.text:
This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode
comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
